    <h1 style="background-color: gold; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;"> SOME PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES! </h1> <br>
    <img src = "https://html-css-js.com/images/og.jpg" widht="300 height=250">
   <h1 style="background-color: gold; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;"> 1.BASIC KNOWLEDGE OF HTML!</h1>
    <strong><mark><u>WHAT IS HTML?</u></mark></strong> <br >
    <p style="font-size: 20px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">. HTML stands for <u> Hyper Text Markup Language</u> <br >
        . HTML describes the structure of a web page <br >
        . HTML consists of a series of elements <br >
        . HTML used to create a web page <br ><br >

       <div style="font-size: 20px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> HTML is a standardised system for tagging text files that creates the structure for just <br >
        about every page that we find and use on the web. It's HTML that adds in page breaks, <br >
        paragraphs, bold lettering, italics, and more. HTML works to build this structure by <br >
        using tags that tell browsers what to do with text</div> </p>
        <br>
<img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/61/HTML5_logo_and_wordmark.svg/2048px-HTML5_logo_and_wordmark.svg.png" width="300" height="250"> <br>
<h1 style="background-color: gold; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;"> 2.BASIC KNOWLEDGE OF CSS!</h1>
<strong><mark><u>WHAT IS CSS?</u></mark></strong> <br>
<p style="font-size: 20px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">CSS is a language that describes the style of an HTML document. It stands for <u>Cascading Style Sheets.</u> <br>

    CSS is used to define styles for your web pages, including the design, layout, and variations in display <br> for different devices and screen sizes. <br><br><br><br>


    
    Syntax:
    The rule opens with a selector . This selects the HTML element that we are going to style. <br>
    
    We then have a set of curly braces { }. Inside those will be one or more declarations, which take the  <br>form of property and value pairs. <br><br><br><br>


  <h2> There are 3 methods to put CSS into document:</h2><br>
    
  <div style="font-size: 20px; font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> <b>1. External stylesheet </b><br>
   <b>2. Internal stylesheet</b> <br>
   <b>3. Inline style</b></div> <br></p> <br><br>
   <img src="data:image/png;base64,"> <br>
   <h1 style="background-color: gold; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;"> 3. BASIC KNOWLEDGE OF JAVASCRIPT!</h1>
   <strong><mark><u>WHAT IS<u> JAVASCRIPT?</u></u></mark></strong> <BR>

    <p style="font-size: 20px;font-family: system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;">Javascript is a MUST for students and working professionals to become a great Software Engineer specially when they are working in Web Development Domain. <br> I will list down some of the key advantages of learning Javascript:

      Javascript is the most popular programming language in the world and  that makes it a programmer’s <br> great choice. Once you learnt Javascript, it helps you developing great front-end as well as back-end softwares using different Javascript based  frameworks like jQuery, <br> Node.JS etc.
      
      Javascript is everywhere, it comes installed on every modern web browser and so to learn Javascript you really do not need any special  environment setup. <br>For example  Chrome, Mozilla Firefox , Safari and every browser you  know as of today, supports Javascript.
      
      Javascript helps you create really  beautiful and crazy fast <br> websites. You can develop your website with a console  like look and feel and give your users the best Graphical User Experience.
      
      JavaScript usage  has now extended to <br> mobile  app development,  desktop app development, and game development. This opens many opportunities for you as Javascript Programmer.
      
      Due to high demand, <br> there is tons of job growth  and high pay for those who know JavaScript. You can navigate over to different job sites to see what having JavaScript skills looks like  in the <br> job market.
      
      Great thing about Javascript is that you will find tons of frameworks and Libraries already developed which can be used  directly in your software development <br> to reduce your time to market.</p>
